source:
# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (timesheets) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock)
- **New Data:** where a segment_id in the source does not exist as an SegmentID in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on segment_id in source and SegmentID in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an SegmentID in the target exists but the same information doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View timesheets_work_segment_lock_new is created

%%sql
-- Build religion_dim table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW timesheets_work_segment_lock_new

    AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT
    CASE
        WHEN T1.id IS NULL
        THEN T5.WorkSegmentLockID
    END                             AS TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID, -- surrogate key
    T1.id                           AS WorkSegmentLockID,
    T4.EmployeeID                   AS EmployeeID,
    T1.first_date_of_week           AS FirstDateOfWeek,
    T1.created_at                   AS CreatedAt,
    T2.SourceSystemID               AS SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from)  AS IngestionDate,
    NULL                            AS ValidTo,
    md5(
        concat(
            IFNULL(T1.id,'.'),
            IFNULL(T4.EmployeeID,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.first_date_of_week,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.created_at,'.')
        ))                          AS RowID,
    'Y'                             AS IsActive,
    T5.IsActive                     AS HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 
    ON "Timesheets" = T2.Description 
        AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_standardised_db.timesheets_employee T3 
    ON T1.employee_id = T3.employee_id
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_fact T4 
    ON T3.staff_number = T4.EmployeeNumber 
        AND T4.IsActive = 'Y'
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock_dim T5 
    ON T1.id = T5.WorkSegmentLockID 
        AND T5.IsActive = 'Y' 
WHERE
        -- flags new data        
        ( CASE
            WHEN T1.id = T5.WorkSegmentLockID 
                AND md5(
                    concat(
                        IFNULL(T1.id,'.'),
                        IFNULL(T4.EmployeeID,'.'),
                        IFNULL(T1.first_date_of_week,'.'),
                        IFNULL(T1.created_at,'.')
                    )) <> T5.RowID
            THEN 'Y'
            WHEN T5.WorkSegmentLockID IS NULL
            THEN 'Y'
            ELSE 'N'
        END  = 'Y' )

    AND T1.id IS NOT NULL
    AND T1.expected_from = (SELECT MAX(expected_from) FROM odw_standardised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock);

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **table_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View table_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW timesheets_work_segment_lock_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 

Select 
    TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID,
    WorkSegmentLockID,
    EmployeeID,
    FirstDateOfWeek,
    CreatedAt,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
From timesheets_work_segment_lock_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'

SELECT
    TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID,
    WorkSegmentLockID,
    EmployeeID,
    FirstDateOfWeek,
    CreatedAt,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock_dim
WHERE TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID IN (SELECT TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID FROM timesheets_work_segment_lock_new WHERE EmployeeID IS NULL)
AND IsActive = 'Y';
## Cell to calculate ValidTo date for changed registers

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM timesheets_work_segment_lock_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW timesheets_work_segment_lock_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID,
    WorkSegmentLockID,
    EmployeeID,
    FirstDateOfWeek,
    CreatedAt,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM timesheets_work_segment_lock_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View TABLE_dim_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key, ValidTo is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised.XXX_dim is updated

%%sql

-- merge into table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock_dim AS Target
USING timesheets_work_segment_lock_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID = Target.TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID

-- updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'
        
-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID,
        WorkSegmentLockID,
        EmployeeID,
        FirstDateOfWeek,
        CreatedAt,
        SourceSystemID,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)  
        VALUES (Source.TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID,
        Source.WorkSegmentLockID,
        Source.EmployeeID,
        Source.FirstDateOfWeek,
        Source.CreatedAt,
        Source.SourceSystemID, 
        Source.IngestionDate, 
        Source.ValidTo, 
        Source.RowID, 
        Source.IsActive) 
;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.TABLE_dim is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new ID

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock_dim

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID NULLS LAST) AS TimesheetsWorkSegmentLockID,
    WorkSegmentLockID,
    EmployeeID,
    FirstDateOfWeek,
    CreatedAt,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.timesheets_work_segment_lock_dim;
